title: IT Executive Job at Merit Healthcare Limited
content:
Merit Healthcare Limited is a Pharmaceutical Company that deals with importation, distribution and marketing of pharmaceutical products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Executive

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The IT Executive is responsible for managing and supporting the day-to-day IT operations of the organization, including system administration, hardware and software support, network management, data security, and troubleshooting.
	The role ensures that all IT infrastructure runs efficiently and supports the organization’s objectives through the effective use of technology.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, configure, and maintain hardware and software systems, including desktops, laptops, printers, servers, and mobile devices.
	Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to staff across all departments on IT-related issues.
	Monitor and maintain IT infrastructure, including LAN/WAN, routers, switches, firewalls, and internet connectivity.
	Implement software updates, patches, and antivirus protection across all systems and devices.
	Assist in planning and executing IT projects, such as system upgrades, migrations, and new installations.
	Ensure data backup and disaster recovery protocols are followed and systems are secure against threats.
	Manage email systems, user accounts, and access controls in line with company policies.
	Maintain IT asset inventory and oversee procurement, licensing, and maintenance of software and hardware.
	Support the implementation of ERP, CRM, or other enterprise solutions, working closely with vendors and internal users.
	Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, internal policies, and IT best practices.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with at least 5 years of experience.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Solid knowledge of IT systems, networking, and hardware
	Strong troubleshooting and diagnostic skills
	Familiarity with Microsoft Office 365, Windows OS, Linux (where applicable)
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities under pressure
	Good understanding of cybersecurity practices
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Strong documentation and reporting skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: odewale_shola@merithealthcare.com.ng using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

title: Personal Assistant (P.A) to the Executive Director Job at Africa Youth Growth Foundation (AYGF)
content:
Africa Youth Growth Foundation (AYGF) is a regional non- Governmental Organisation that focuses on the following thematic areas ; Migration, Public Health, Education, Democratic Governance, livelihood, Climate Change and Environment

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant (P.A) to the Executive Director
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Personal Assistant (P.A) to the Executive Director (ED) will provide high-level administrative, strategic, and operational support to ensure the smooth functioning of the Executive Director’s office.
	The role requires a proactive, highly organized, and discreet individual capable of managing competing priorities and representing the ED with professionalism in all engagements.


Responsibilities


	Manage the ED’s calendar, schedule meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements.
	Handle confidential correspondence, reports, and documents on behalf of the ED.
	Serve as the first point of contact for internal and external stakeholders seeking audience with the ED.
	Organize logistics for meetings, retreats, and public engagements involving the ED.
	Maintain an efficient electronic and physical filing system for the ED’s office.
	Assist in conducting research and compiling briefing documents and reports.
	Draft, edit, and format memos, presentations, speeches, and official communications.
	Coordinate and prepare background materials and agendas for meetings, conferences, and engagements.
	Follow up on action points and ensure deadlines are met.
	Ensure the ED is well-prepared for all meetings and external engagements.
	Represent the ED in meetings or engagements when delegated.


Qualifications and Experience


	Qualification should be a minimum of a B.Sc. in Administration, Social Sciences, Communications, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of proven experience as a Personal Assistant, Executive Assistant, or in a similar role.
	Experience working in an NGO or development sector is highly desirable.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and a Cover Letter detailing relevant experience and motivation. to: recruitment@aygf.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Human Resource Manager Job at Pavilion Technology Limited
content:

We are dedicated to ensuring your safety by combining unmatched expertise and skill to design and implement protection solutions that creates a secure customer experience, foster business security reinvention, streamline operational excellence, and deliver trust and compliance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager
Job Location: Lagos MainLand, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities

title: Network Operations Manager  Job at Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company (IKEDC)
content:
Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company (IKEDC) - Buoyed by a mission to redefine customer experience and be the provider of choice wherever energy is consumed, the Ikeja Electric (IE), Nigeria's largest power distribution network, came into existence on November 1st, 2013 following the handover of the defunct Power Holding Company Of Nigeria (PHCN) to NEDC/ KEPCO Consortium under the privatization scheme of the Federal Government of Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Operations Manager 
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Network Operations Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all operations and maintenance activities within the business unit.
	You will lead efforts to ensure the smooth functioning of the distribution network, prevent equipment failure, and implement strategies for loss and accident reduction.


You Will Contribute To


	Allocating tasks and supervising employees to ensure targets are met within the business unit.
	Auditing records to maintain compliancewith operational methods and qualit standards.
	Planning, organizing, and coordinating the operation and maintenance of 11kV and 415kV distribution networks.
	Managing technical activities for smooth functioning of the network and ensuring timely inspections and commissioning of new projects.
	Collaborating with the Corporate Office and managing materials, budgets, and resources for efficient operations.
	Driving loss reduction strategies and ensuring compliance with safety and regulatory policies.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related technical field.


Work Experience:


	A minimum 8-10 years of relevant work experience in operations and maintenance within the power sector.


Skills & Competencies:


	The role affords you to develop technical and behavioral competencies, that is, skills, knowledge, and behaviors required to successfully perform in the role and contribute to the organization's goals.


Technical Competencies:


	Network Data Analysis Management
	Operations & Maintenance Management
	Sub-station Planning Maintenance
	System Support Load Management
	High & Low Tension Operation & Maintenance Management
	Network Location Mapping
	Equipment Testing & Commissioning Management
	Electricity Industry Regulatory Knowledge


Behavioral Competencies:


	Customer Centricity – Minimize downtime and enhance service reliability to improve customer experience.
	Risk Management – Identify potential risks and implement preventive measures to ensure system stability.
	People Leadership – Guide maintenance teams for effective task execution and strict adherence to safety protocols.
	Supervisory/Managerial Skills – Oversee daily operations, ensuring timely issue resolution and regulatory compliance.
	Entrepreneurship – Drive process improvements and cost-effective solutions for operational efficiency.
	Change Management – Adapt to new technologies and evolving maintenance strategies to boost performance.
	Result-Driven Approach – Optimize resource allocation to meet maintenance goals and minimize downtime.


Minimum Requirements:


	This opportunity is a Senior Manager role; the complexity of this role will work across all Functions and Department of the Business.
	The role reports directly to the Business Manager.
